get.description: List all environments associated with a CSP.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of environments to return. The service may return fewer
than this value.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListEnvironments` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListEnvironments` must
match the call that provided the page token.

post.description:
Allows a provider to validate the authenticity of an activation key before
creating a connection associated with it.

FUTURE: In the future, we may allow providers to convey additional
        provisioning information excluded from the activation key in their
        response.

patch.description:
Update a specific connection's attributes.

When calling this API if the field being updated is synchronized between
the providers, the remote provider should update their local connection
state before requesting an update to the server provider resource.  When
requesting an update to a connection, all remote provider update requests
must be rejected.

Errors:
  409: CONFLICT. Returned when a server detect concurrent updates to the
  resource.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: interconnect
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: updateMask
parameters.description: The list of fields to update.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

get.description: List all connections associated with a given interconnect.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: interconnect
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of connections to return. The service may return fewer
than this value.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListConnections` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListConnections` must
match the call that provided the page token.

post.description:
Create a new connection associated with a given interconnect.

When calling this API, remote providers must first create a connection
resource locally.  This ensures the remote provider can handle server
failures (retries and cleanup).

If connection creation fails, the provider should restart their call flow
refreshing any environment and interconnect details used to create the
request and retry.  When retrying, client should use an exponential
backoff strategy for up to 60 seconds.

Errors:
    409: CONFLICT. The resource is being created or has already been
    created.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description:
Required. The ID to use for the connection, which will become the final component of
the connection's resource name.

get.description: Retrieves all feature guidance associated with a connection.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: interconnect
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

post.description:
Notify a remote provider that the provisioning status of a connection has
changed.

A provider will typically send a remote provider two updates:
1) A notification when a newly created channel has transitioned from
   PENDING to FINALIZED
2) A notification when an existing channel transitions from FINALIZED
   to PENDING.  This happens when features change and need finalization.
3) A notification when a channel is FINALIZED after a feature change.

get.description: List all features associated with a given connection.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: interconnect
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: connection
parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of features to return. The service may return fewer
than this value.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous `ListFeatures` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to `ListFeatures` must
match the call that provided the page token.

post.description:
Create a new feature associated with a connection.

Multiple feature creation requests for the same resource may be sent by a
remote provider simultaneously.  The server provider must ensure that any
resource reservations are performed sequentially across those requests to
prevent race conditions.

Typical feature creation flow:

1. Create server connection.
2. Request feature guidance for connection.
3. Select desired configuration parameters from guidance and create local
feature.
4. Create server feature.
5. Await finalization.

If *any* errors occur in the described flow, the remote provider is
responsible for reconciling the server's state to determine if an existing
request is in flight, retrying the provisioning flow with new parameters,
or cleaning up resources and rejecting the customer's provisioning request.

Errors:
  409: CONFLICT. Returned when a server detect concurrent updates to the
  resource.

parameters.description: Resource ID segment making up resource `name`.

parameters.name: featureId
parameters.description:
Required. The ID to use for the feature, which will become the final component of
the feature's resource name.

prettyPrint.name: $prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

Provider.description:
Provider resources encapsulate all information that describe the
relationship between a remote provider and a server provider.

When a remote provider calls this API, the provider should always reference
their assigned provider id.  Provider IDs are globally unique, and stored in
this specification's opensource repository.  This allows a remote provider to
have access to multiple provider IDs as business relationship change over
time.

For example, if we have two providers (ProviderA, ProviderB) who are
coordinating connections with this API, when ProviderA (remote provider)
calls this API hosted by ProviderB (server provider), their requests will
always be prefixed by:

Prefix: providers/

If the server provider has decided that ProviderA's credentials allow them to
access additional credentials (through something like an acquisition),
ProviderA may access all resources under ProviderC.

ProviderB must also allow ProviderA to access the server's provider resource
(providers/).  This provides ProviderA with access to relevant
information about the server provider (such as display names).

name.description:
Identifier. Unique identifier for a Provider resource.

Every provider that supports the cloud connectivity API will receive a
centrally managed provider ID, stored alongside this specification in the
opensource project, that uniquely identifies them.  When accessing a remote
cloud connectivity server, the provider will use their provider ID to
request and create resources within the remote server.

displayName.description:
Output only. Provider name suitable for display to end users.

Example: Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, etc

Environment.description:
Environments define high level connection points between two providers.

Environment resources support the following
1. Conveying to end customers where and how two providers can be connected.
2. Display information for describing these environments.

Providers exchange environment information when establishing connectivity and
this resource is provided for troubleshooting and validation purposes.
Providers generally have a local copy of this information and do not need to
request it when servicing requests.

name.description: Identifier. Unique identifier for an Environment resource.

providerSites.description:
Output only. A unique mapping between a provider and a site code.  This field should
never contain more than 2 entries.  One entry should be a mapping
between the server's provider ID and a site identifier, the other entry
should be the parent provider ID and a site identifier.

Example: [
           {"providerId": "provider1", "site": "us-east4"},
           {"providerId": "provider2", "site": "us-east1"},
         ]

apiUri.description:
API endpoint for communicating with the parent provider about this
environment resource and all child resources.

Example:
remoteprovider.com/v1/projects/123/locations/us-east4/

supportedConnectionSizeMbps.description:
Output only. A list of Mbps connection sizes supported by all interconnects in the
environment.

supportedFeatures.description: Output only. A list of features supported by all interconnects in the environment.

environmentVisibility.description:
Output only. Controls the visibility of this environment in the provider's customer
facing APIs.

ProviderSites.description: A mapping of a provider id to their API and display names for sites.

providerId.description: Which provider this site data is associated with.

site.description: A provider specific site name (e.g. us-east4).

displayName.description: A display name for the site for use in customer facing UI.

ListEnvironmentsResponse.description: Response for obtaining multiple environment resources.

environments.description: The environments from the specified provider.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

ConfirmActivationKeyRequest.description:
Request to confirm the validity of a activation key provided by a remote
provider.

ActivationKey.description:
Activation Keys contain all information needed by a provider to validate a
activation proposal between two provider.

The activation key should be base64 encoded whenever it is exchanged between
providers.  This helps prevent accidental corruption of the key when
transferring it between clouds.

environment.description: Required. The connection environment this activation key is associated with.

connectionSizeMbps.description: Required. Size of the connection to be provisioned in mbps.

keyMaterial.description:
Required. Unique key material generated by a provider to link this request to a
specific customer.

ConfirmActivationKeyResponse.description:
Response from a provider about the validity of the key and any additional
metadata that is needed for turn up.

keyValid.description: Indicates if the remote CSP believes this key is valid.

Interconnect.description:
Interconnect resources describe a group of redundant physical links between
providers that are used to provision redundant connections for a customer.

Interconnect resource 'name' and 'supported_connection_size_mbps' are
exchanged between providers at setup time.  This allows both providers to
call each other's respective APIs with a shared resource key and lookup
additional dynamic details about the connectivity.

All other fields are controlled by the server provider.

name.description: Identifier. Unique identifier for the Interconnect resource.

supportedConnectionSizeMbps.description:
Output only. A list of Mbps connection sizes supported on the interconnect.  This field
must contain all supported connection sizes defined in the parent
environment but may include additional sizes specific to this interconnect.

supportedFeatures.description:
Output only. A list of features supported by the interconnect.  Any child connections of
this interconnect may have the specified features configured on them. This
field must contain all supported features defined in the parent
environment but may include additional features specific to this
interconnect.

status.description:
Output only. The operational status of the interconnect used to control connection
provisioning.

INTERCONNECT_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED - Unspecified interconnect status
INTERCONNECT_STATUS_PENDING - Provisioning is pending and not ready for production traffic.
INTERCONNECT_STATUS_READY - Provisioning is complete and ready for production traffic.
INTERCONNECT_STATUS_CLOSED - Functional for current customers but closed to new connections.

maxBandwidthMbps.description:
Output only. Specified the aggregate connection bandwidth that can be configured on the
interconnect.  Generally this value matches the minimum channel bandwidth
across all channels associated with the interconnect.  However, this field
allows a a provider to limit the total connection bandwidth below the
aggregate physical capacity.

If not respected by the remote provider, connection creation that exceeds
this threshold will fail.

ListInterconnectsResponse.description: Response for obtaining multiple interconnect resources.

interconnects.description: The interconnects from the specified provider.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

Channel.description:
Channels describe individual physical connections that connect a remote
provider's router to a server provider's router.

The following fields are pre-exchanged between providers when
provisioning capacity:

1. name

2. macsec_manager_provider_id

3. cross_connect_manager_provider_id

All other fields within the channel are populated by the server provider.

name.description: Identifier. Unique identifier for the Channel resource.

macsecManagerProvider.description:
Output only. The URI of the provider responsible for managing MacSec key rotations.

This field must prevent the non-manager provider from calling Macsec
APIs.

crossConnectManagerProvider.description:
Output only. The URI of the provider responsible for managing physical crossconnects.  This
includes cross connect costs and any troubleshooting requests to the vendor
providing the cross connect.

aggregateChannelSizeGbps.description: Output only. Aggregate channel size in gigabits per second.

channelMemberSizeGbps.description: Output only. Individual channel member size in gigabits per second.

obfuscatedDeviceId.description:
Output only. An obfuscated device ID associated with the network device hosting the
channel.  This field allows providers to check that channel diversity
requirements are met within a parent interconnect resource.

demarc.description:
A demarcation identifier that uniquely identifies where the cross connect
is connected.  This identifier is typically provided by the colocation
facility and can be found in letters of authorization when turning up
capacity.

adminStatus.description:
Output only. The administrative status of the channel.  This field is used by a provider
to signal a channel has been intentionally disabled.

ListChannelsResponse.description: Response for obtaining multiple channel resources.

channels.description: The channels from the specified provider.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

NotifyMaintenanceRequest.description:
A notification from a remote provider that a maintenance has been updated on
a channel.

events.description:
All maintenance events associated with the channel. At the time of sending
the notification.

MaintenanceEvent.description: A maintenance event scheduled or in progress associated with a channel.

startTime.description: The timestamp when a maintenance will start or started in the past.

endTime.description: The timestamp when a maintenance will end.

maintenanceId.description:
An opaque maintenance identifier that can be used when communicating with
a provider to uniquely identify the maintenance event.

Empty.description:
A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
empty messages in your APIs.

GetMaintenanceEventsResponse.description: Response for getting maintenance events for a channel.

events.description: The maintenance events for the specified channel.

Connection.description:
Connection resources contain all connection wide details about a connection
configured on behalf of a customer between two clouds.

Connection resources must have the following attributes:

1. When created, the connection must reserve bandwidth on their associated
   interconnect.
2. A remote provider must create a connection locally before requesting a
   server provider create a connection.
3. Connections that were never finalized may be deleted by either provider
   after 7 days.
4. Connections present on only one provider may be deleted after 7 days.
5. When deleted, the server provider is responsible for invalidating the key
   material associated with the connection to avoid accidental reuse.

name.description: Identifier. A unique identifier for the connection resource.

activationKey.description: Identifier. A activation key associated with the connection.

bandwidthMbps.description:
The total bandwidth associated with a connection.  This bandwidth is what
has been sold to the customer, there may be more capacity reserved after
provisioning the connection across multiple channels.

adminStatus.description: Output only. The administrative status of the connection resource.

provisioningStatus.description:
Output only. The provisioning status of the connection resource.

Status conditions:

PENDING:
  1. Connection is created and capacity is reserved.
  2. Negotiation is proceeding to configure connection features.

FINALIZED:
  1. All features are in a FINALIZED state.

ListConnectionsResponse.description: Response for obtaining multiple connection resources.

connections.description: The connections from the specified provider.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

GetFeatureGuidanceResponse.description: All feature guidance associated with a connection.

featureGuidance.description:
Output only. A list of guidance a remote provider can use to provision features on the
created connection.  The list should include a feature guidance object for
every channel associated with the interconnect the connection is
provisioned on.

FeatureGuidance.description:
FeatureGuidance contains a list of preferences and restrictions associated
with feature creation.  When fields are unpopulated, the server has no
restrictions or preferences.  Unless specified as a preference, the server
provider is expected to reject feature creation requests that deviate from
the feature guidance restrictions returned.

featureType.description: The feature type associated with this guidance.

l3BaseGuidance.description: All configuration guidance associated with a FEATURE_TYPE_L3_BASE.

L3BaseGuidance.description: All guidance associated with the FEATURE_TYPE_L3_BASE.

asn.description:
A list of non-overlapping ASN ranges a provider can select from.

Many providers only support one ASN.  In this case, asn.start == asn.end.

subnetGuidanceIpv4.description:
A list of non-overlapping IP subnets a provider can select from.

Many providers allow connections within the link local IP space.
Example:

[
  {{"includeSubnet": "169.254.0.0/16"},
  {"excludeSubnet": "169.254.1.0/28"},
  {"preferredSubnet":"169.254.1.16/30"}},
]

subnetGuidanceIpv6.description: A list of non-overlapping IPv6 subnets a provider can select from.

allowedSubnetSizeIpv4.description: The subnet sizes allowed when selecting an IP subnet for a connection.

allowedSubnetSizeIpv6.description: The subnet sizes allowed when selecting an IP subnet for a connection.

vlan.description: A list of VLANs the provider may select from.

mtu.description:
A list of non-overlapping MTU ranges a provider can select from.

Special note: This represents the MTU limits at the connection points
between providers, there may be further limitations within provider
networks that must be explained in customer facing APIs and / or
documentation.

maxPrefixes.description:
Maximum number of prefixes accepted by the connection.

While not negotiated between providers, providers must be aware that if
more prefixes are announced, protocol behavior will be undefined.

Subnet.description:
An IP subnet usable by a provider when provisioning.

Note: This subnet can be broken down into smaller subnets when
provisioning.

includeSubnet.description: A prefix a provider may select within.

excludeSubnet.description:
A list of subnets that should be excluded when creating a new
feature.

preferredSubnet.description: A subnet preferred by the server when creating a new feature

VLANRange.description:
A range of VLAN IDs that a provider may select from.

The remote provider should have full visibility into what has been
provisioned from this range.  The server will not filter out any used
VLANs on behalf of the caller.

MTURange.description:
A range of MTUs that a provider may select from.

The remote provider should select the highest MTU supported by both
providers.

NotifyConnectionStatusRequest.description:
A notification from a remote provider that a connection's status has been
updated.

Feature.description:
Feature resources describe all configuration per-channel that is required to
enable a feature for a specified connection.

name.description: Identifier. A unique identifier for the feature resource.

channel.description:
Required. The URI of the channel this feature is associated with.

Each feature is only associated with a single channel and the channel must
exist. Each connection resource will have a child feature for each channel
that is a child of the parent interconnect resource. For example a
connection that is a child of an interconnect with 4 channels will have 4
child features, each associated with a different channel.

featureConfig.description: All configuration associated with the feature.

provisioningStatus.description:
Output only. The provisioning status of the feature.

Status conditions:

PENDING:
  1. Feature is created and parameters are reserved.

FINALIZED:
  1. Configuration has propagated fully to the provider's infrastructure.
  2. Customer may send production traffic between providers using the
     feature.

FeatureConfig.description: Feature specific configuration associated with a Feature resource.

featureType.description: The feature type this configuration contains.

l3BaseConfig.description: All configuration associated with the FEATURE_TYPE_L3_BASE

ipv4Subnet.description:
Required. IPv4 subnet used to establish L3 connectivity for the customer

Note: The IP address must have the subnet mask applied to it.

ipv6Subnet.description:
Optional. IPv6 subnet used to establish L3 connectivity for the customer

Note: The IP address must have the subnet mask applied to it.

mtuBytes.description:
Required. MTU for VLAN attachments.

Special note: This represents the MTU at the connection points
between providers, there may be further MTU limitations within provider
networks.

vlanId.description:
Required. VLAN ID used by the connection.

VLAN 1024 and lower are reserved and cannot have features associated with
them.  Otherwise, a provider may select from any available VLANs.

providerBgpConfigs.description:
Required. A mapping of provider ID to all BGP session attributes the provider
should use.

md5BgpPassword.description: Shared MD5 password for BGP sessions.

ProviderBgpConfig.description:
All parameters needed for a provider to configure a BGP session
associated with a channel.

provider.description:
Required. The resource name of the provider that this BGP configuration is
associated with.

asn.description: Required. The ASN associated with the provider.

hostIpv4.description: Required. IPv4 address hosting BGP session for provider.

hostIpv6.description: Optional. IPv6 address hosting BGP session for provider.

ListFeaturesResponse.description: Response for obtaining multiple feature resources.

features.description: The features from the specified provider.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

FeatureType.description:
FEATURE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED - Unspecified feature type.
FEATURE_TYPE_L3_BASE - Primary feature used to connect Layer 3 traffic.

EnvironmentVisibility.description:
Enum that describes the visibility of an environment.
 ENVIRONMENT_VISIBILITY_PRIVATE - A private environment has limited visibility (as jointly defined by
providers) to an individual or small number of customers.
ENVIRONMENT_VISIBILITY_PUBLIC - A public environment is visible to all provider customers with little to no
restriction.

AdminStatus.description:
ADMIN_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED - Admin status is unspecified
ADMIN_STATUS_ENABLED - A provider has administratively enabled a resource.
ADMIN_STATUS_DISABLED - A provider has administratively disabled a resource.

ProvisioningStatus.description:
PROVISIONING_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED - Unspecified provisioning status
PROVISIONING_STATUS_PENDING - Provisioning is pending and not ready for production traffic.
PROVISIONING_STATUS_FINAL - Provisioning is complete and ready for production traffic.
